The hotel is very low cost and meets the basic requirements.  The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.  There was no refrigerator or microwave in the room but that didn't matter since I'd planned to eat out anyway, and there were several restaurants within a few blocks.  You have to ask for room service, but the staff did an excellent job when service was requested.
Decent place but lots of noise near my room
 I asked for a room on the first floor because I have knee implants and a fused spine and climbing stairs is difficult for me.  This turned out to be a mistake as the three rooms on the first floor were next to the interior parking and very close to the reception desk.  There was a large door on the first floor that was closed during the night, from about 10 PM to 6:30 AM, but people were arriving all night, or trying to leave from the internal parking during the night, and the doorbell on the front door was set up to be very loud so that the receptionist could hear it wherever he was.  It rang so loudly that it would wake me up several times a night.  Ditto for the telephone on the reception desk.  The hotel seemed to be used by truck drivers who would leave very early in the morning, and they would load up their trucks in the indoor parking area.  One night, a truck prepared to leave at 2:20 AM and started using a lift gate to load some kind of metal objects, which were then pushed into the truck with lots of squealing noises.  Apparently one member of the truck crew didn't wake up on time, and rather than going to his door and waking him, the driver started honking the truck's horn repeatedly, which went on for 12 minutes until the offender showed up ready to hit the road.  Loud noise was so frequent during the night that it was hard to get much sleep.  I suspect things would be much better on the second or third floors, so the noise problem might not be a fair criticism of the entire hotel, but I'd certainly recommend avoiding a first floor room if possible.

Desconexión total en la naturaleza, el personal (Rosa y Verónica) insuperables, comida deliciosa, descanso excelente. Experiencia 10/10. Mi novio y yo lo disfrutamos mucho.

p_comentario: Leuke suite. Heerlijke jacuzzi. Personeel erg behulpzaam en flexibel met uitchecken. Grote tv met opties voor YouTube en Netflix! :) Jammer dat beamer het alleen via WiFi doet, gezien niet iedereen mobiele data heeft. Ontbijt zou top zijn met optie voor thee ipv koffie.

nombreh_id: Cosmos Chill - Suite con jacuzzi y acuario
p_comentario:
This unique room is very special, full of creativity and positive energy.  The décor is calming and literally makes you smile.  Modern bathroom is clean and comfortable.  King-size bed was an added bonus.  Soaking tub was a relaxing way to spend some time watching a series, a movie or F1; LOVED the well-taken care of fish tanks and the "tub table" for our laptop and drinks.  Breakfast served to the room was DELICIOUS and very well presented.  There is a great japanese-style table in the room with cushions to sit on while eating.  Closet with hangers was appreciated.  Parking is a tight squeeze, but available inside the gated land, right outside the room.  Hosts answered all of our requests and questions immediately and It was really the perfect place to call home with a great, central location while we explored Ambato and the surrounding areas for a long weekend getaway.
A hidden gem in the middle of Ambato for a relaxing getaway while exploring the area.
 A few extra towels would have made a difference in our comfort level due to the amount of time spent in water in the room.  I would also suggest more ventilation in the bathroom.  That said, the fan in the room was a good way to keep air moving, especially when opening the main door.  A little more instruction on the cool electronic elements in the room would have helped us enjoy them more (large TV, Alexa, and home theater system).  Finally, the Internet, while good enough for sending messages, could not support Netflix or streaming on our devices and meant that we used a lot of data.  None of these issues prevented us from enjoying our weekend, though, and are only mentioned to help improve something already very special.

p_comentario:
Clean and beautifully decorated room. Large candelit bath (unused) and very nice hot shower. Large and comfortable bed. Perfect WiFi. Area felt very safe. Really well located next to the two best parks (with amazing topiary) we saw in all of Ambato. The atmosphere on Sundays is particularly great. Just a 20 minute walk into central Ambato. Hosts are charming too. We would not consider staying anywhere else in Ambato.

Recomendadísimo. Esta es definitivamente una perla escondida, de esas muy inusuales que no se merecen menos que una puntuación perfecta. 
La casa, habitaciones y lugares comunales son muy bonitas y acogedoras, muy buen decorado, artístico sin ser estrambótico, y el servicio (Cristhian en mi caso, más el personal de limpieza y del restaurante) fueron muy amables, eficientes y de increíble ayuda. 
La ubicación es buenísima también, cerca de todo, especialmente para alguien que no conocía la ciudad y tenía poco tiempo para explorarla. 
Mi estadía en Loja se extendió por una noche más, y fue obvio que no habría mejor lugar para hospedarme en la ciudad otra vez.

The hotel is very low cost and meets the basic requirements.  The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.  There was no refrigerator or microwave in the room but that didn't matter since I'd planned to eat out anyway, and there were several restaurants within a few blocks.  You have to ask for room service, but the staff did an excellent job when service was requested.
Decent place but lots of noise near my room
 I asked for a room on the first floor because I have knee implants and a fused spine and climbing stairs is difficult for me.  This turned out to be a mistake as the three rooms on the first floor were next to the interior parking and very close to the reception desk.  There was a large door on the first floor that was closed during the night, from about 10 PM to 6:30 AM, but people were arriving all night, or trying to leave from the internal parking during the night, and the doorbell on the front door was set up to be very loud so that the receptionist could hear it wherever he was.  It rang so loudly that it would wake me up several times a night.  Ditto for the telephone on the reception desk.  The hotel seemed to be used by truck drivers who would leave very early in the morning, and they would load up their trucks in the indoor parking area.  One night, a truck prepared to leave at 2:20 AM and started using a lift gate to load some kind of metal objects, which were then pushed into the truck with lots of squealing noises.  Apparently one member of the truck crew didn't wake up on time, and rather than going to his door and waking him, the driver started honking the truck's horn repeatedly, which went on for 12 minutes until the offender showed up ready to hit the road.  Loud noise was so frequent during the night that it was hard to get much sleep.  I suspect things would be much better on the second or third floors, so the noise problem might not be a fair criticism of the entire hotel, but I'd certainly recommend avoiding a first floor room if possible.

p_comentario: Leuke suite. Heerlijke jacuzzi. Personeel erg behulpzaam en flexibel met uitchecken. Grote tv met opties voor YouTube en Netflix! :) Jammer dat beamer het alleen via WiFi doet, gezien niet iedereen mobiele data heeft. Ontbijt zou top zijn met optie voor thee ipv koffie.

nombreh_id: Cosmos Chill - Suite con jacuzzi y acuario
p_comentario:
This unique room is very special, full of creativity and positive energy.  The décor is calming and literally makes you smile.  Modern bathroom is clean and comfortable.  King-size bed was an added bonus.  Soaking tub was a relaxing way to spend some time watching a series, a movie or F1; LOVED the well-taken care of fish tanks and the "tub table" for our laptop and drinks.  Breakfast served to the room was DELICIOUS and very well presented.  There is a great japanese-style table in the room with cushions to sit on while eating.  Closet with hangers was appreciated.  Parking is a tight squeeze, but available inside the gated land, right outside the room.  Hosts answered all of our requests and questions immediately and It was really the perfect place to call home with a great, central location while we explored Ambato and the surrounding areas for a long weekend getaway.
A hidden gem in the middle of Ambato for a relaxing getaway while exploring the area.
 A few extra towels would have made a difference in our comfort level due to the amount of time spent in water in the room.  I would also suggest more ventilation in the bathroom.  That said, the fan in the room was a good way to keep air moving, especially when opening the main door.  A little more instruction on the cool electronic elements in the room would have helped us enjoy them more (large TV, Alexa, and home theater system).  Finally, the Internet, while good enough for sending messages, could not support Netflix or streaming on our devices and meant that we used a lot of data.  None of these issues prevented us from enjoying our weekend, though, and are only mentioned to help improve something already very special.

p_comentario:
Clean and beautifully decorated room. Large candelit bath (unused) and very nice hot shower. Large and comfortable bed. Perfect WiFi. Area felt very safe. Really well located next to the two best parks (with amazing topiary) we saw in all of Ambato. The atmosphere on Sundays is particularly great. Just a 20 minute walk into central Ambato. Hosts are charming too. We would not consider staying anywhere else in Ambato.

It is very close to numerous tourist and historical sites, like famous churches, museums, and Independance Square, all within walking distance, and saving a lot of traffic jam if one were to be in the new town. 
Hotel assistant (Mr. Darwin) was very helpful and assisted in arranging for site tours by car, airport drop-off. The restaurant affiliated to the hotel was very homely and service was warm and kind, with candle light dinner and hot breakfast. Food was prepared with daily new purchase like meat and vegetables. Mr. Efren Lopez, driver of a hotel arranged car, was very polite and helpful, serving also as a tourist guide. He used phone tool for instant translation and communication with passengers and drove safely. His car service charged very fairly. He was able to make visitors feel comfortable. We took a photo with him at the airport for departure as a good keepsake and good memory. I would strongly recommend him as the best option (Mr. Darwin has his contact).
An advanturous trip at such high altitude. Walk and talk slowly in Quito and take deep breath!

 We were able to take hot shower only once. After that the “eco solar system” shut down or broke and we were left without hot water - really disappointing after full days of sightseeing.  All the signs about eco friendliness do not make sense since the sink was leaking  and we left the shower water running for 5-10 in hope of hot water (water wasted). We were told to let it run for 2-3 mins but then we realized something was wrong and we were out of luck for hot water for two days.  The staff was very friendly and helpful but the hot water problem was not theirs to resolve, especially on the weekend.

 The internet is not great. Essentially had to sign in on our laptops several times and it would send us to Microsoft browser, then flake out a little while in, pretty frustrating system. The breakfast had some pros, like fresh juice and fruit, but the eggs were runny each morning and the bread/cheese choices were pretty plain. They keep one street entrance set of doors locked, so it was confusing for cabs and uber which would show up at an entrance and we were at the other side of the building. The windows are paper thin with poor seals, so you hear the party bus, dogs and bars pretty much through the night.

 I booked and paid deluxe king room but when I came to the hotel they wanted to give me a standard room on the second floor. When I requested the room which I paid for they told me that they don't have free any king room. They offered me free breakfast as compensation, however when I come to breakfast the staff was telling me that I didn't pay for the breakfast and I had to explain the situation. The sauna was not working! The herb sauna was cold! The jacuzzi was hot but the jets were not working. Internet is super poor, on average 2mb/s.  I was already in this hotel twice and it's always very cold in the rooms, it's much warmer in the corridors or on the streets. The rooms are not soundproof, you can talk with your neighbor through the walls and the entrance door doesn't seal at all, there is a big gap at the bottom. I wouldn't go here the third time.

Нет звукоизоляции, т.к. нет вентиляции и есть форточка в общие помещения.  Нет шампуня, полотенец. Номер не очень большой, основное пространство занимает кровать. В раковине холодная вода еле течёт. Ночью видел в номере тараканов, видимо из-за общей кухни. Для входа и выхода нужно чтобы открыли дверь в отель, не очень удобно. Хотя вроде немало освещения ощущение что находишься в подвале.

the garden was nice and peaceful

NOT recommended - bad customer service and terrible room
 I was very unhappy about my stay and would recommend against staying in this hostel. The hostel could be nice but it operates in quite an very amateur way. The volunteers are inexperienced in customer service and make many mistakes about rooms bookings.. 1- The room i was given was nothing like what was shown on the picture of booking.com. Instead, I had an old. unpleasant , basic and mouldy 'spare' room, which actually is listed in their reception as 'spare' suggesting this was not the normal room i should have been given. I assume a mistake was made and my room was given to someone else. If so i would have appreciated being advised and given the opportunity of taking a cheaper rate. 2- The volunteer from the Dominican Republic who opened the door when i arrived couldn't have been less welcoming. He was clearly unhappy that I arrived at 10pm and woke him up (even though i had advised of my late arrival several times via messages and they had said it was absolutely fine),. His attitude was unnecessarily unpleasant. He made me feel really unwelcome and uncomfortable. I work in tourism myself and would never dream of welcoming a guests this way. The new (younger ) volunteer was more welcoming and had more customer skills. 3 - I asked if a normal taxi (with a taxi meter) could be booked to the bus station for the next morning. They assured me it would be the case, but the next morning, a private (unofficial) taxi was in front of the door and refused to put the taxi meter saying he had been told to charge me $10 (this is twice the normal price) I shared this feedback with the hostel staff after my stay to give them the opportunity to get back to me but have heard nothing from them. I am left feeling very disappointed.

The hotel is very low cost and meets the basic requirements.  The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.  There was no refrigerator or microwave in the room but that didn't matter since I'd planned to eat out anyway, and there were several restaurants within a few blocks.  You have to ask for room service, but the staff did an excellent job when service was requested.
Decent place but lots of noise near my room
 I asked for a room on the first floor because I have knee implants and a fused spine and climbing stairs is difficult for me.  This turned out to be a mistake as the three rooms on the first floor were next to the interior parking and very close to the reception desk.  There was a large door on the first floor that was closed during the night, from about 10 PM to 6:30 AM, but people were arriving all night, or trying to leave from the internal parking during the night, and the doorbell on the front door was set up to be very loud so that the receptionist could hear it wherever he was.  It rang so loudly that it would wake me up several times a night.  Ditto for the telephone on the reception desk.  The hotel seemed to be used by truck drivers who would leave very early in the morning, and they would load up their trucks in the indoor parking area.  One night, a truck prepared to leave at 2:20 AM and started using a lift gate to load some kind of metal objects, which were then pushed into the truck with lots of squealing noises.  Apparently one member of the truck crew didn't wake up on time, and rather than going to his door and waking him, the driver started honking the truck's horn repeatedly, which went on for 12 minutes until the offender showed up ready to hit the road.  Loud noise was so frequent during the night that it was hard to get much sleep.  I suspect things would be much better on the second or third floors, so the noise problem might not be a fair criticism of the entire hotel, but I'd certainly recommend avoiding a first floor room if possible.

The hotel is very low cost and meets the basic requirements.  The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.  There was no refrigerator or microwave in the room but that didn't matter since I'd planned to eat out anyway, and there were several restaurants within a few blocks.  You have to ask for room service, but the staff did an excellent job when service was requested.
Decent place but lots of noise near my room
 I asked for a room on the first floor because I have knee implants and a fused spine and climbing stairs is difficult for me.  This turned out to be a mistake as the three rooms on the first floor were next to the interior parking and very close to the reception desk.  There was a large door on the first floor that was closed during the night, from about 10 PM to 6:30 AM, but people were arriving all night, or trying to leave from the internal parking during the night, and the doorbell on the front door was set up to be very loud so that the receptionist could hear it wherever he was.  It rang so loudly that it would wake me up several times a night.  Ditto for the telephone on the reception desk.  The hotel seemed to be used by truck drivers who would leave very early in the morning, and they would load up their trucks in the indoor parking area.  One night, a truck prepared to leave at 2:20 AM and started using a lift gate to load some kind of metal objects, which were then pushed into the truck with lots of squealing noises.  Apparently one member of the truck crew didn't wake up on time, and rather than going to his door and waking him, the driver started honking the truck's horn repeatedly, which went on for 12 minutes until the offender showed up ready to hit the road.  Loud noise was so frequent during the night that it was hard to get much sleep.  I suspect things would be much better on the second or third floors, so the noise problem might not be a fair criticism of the entire hotel, but I'd certainly recommend avoiding a first floor room if possible.

nombreh_id: Cosmos Chill - Suite con jacuzzi y acuario
p_comentario:
This unique room is very special, full of creativity and positive energy.  The décor is calming and literally makes you smile.  Modern bathroom is clean and comfortable.  King-size bed was an added bonus.  Soaking tub was a relaxing way to spend some time watching a series, a movie or F1; LOVED the well-taken care of fish tanks and the "tub table" for our laptop and drinks.  Breakfast served to the room was DELICIOUS and very well presented.  There is a great japanese-style table in the room with cushions to sit on while eating.  Closet with hangers was appreciated.  Parking is a tight squeeze, but available inside the gated land, right outside the room.  Hosts answered all of our requests and questions immediately and It was really the perfect place to call home with a great, central location while we explored Ambato and the surrounding areas for a long weekend getaway.
A hidden gem in the middle of Ambato for a relaxing getaway while exploring the area.
 A few extra towels would have made a difference in our comfort level due to the amount of time spent in water in the room.  I would also suggest more ventilation in the bathroom.  That said, the fan in the room was a good way to keep air moving, especially when opening the main door.  A little more instruction on the cool electronic elements in the room would have helped us enjoy them more (large TV, Alexa, and home theater system).  Finally, the Internet, while good enough for sending messages, could not support Netflix or streaming on our devices and meant that we used a lot of data.  None of these issues prevented us from enjoying our weekend, though, and are only mentioned to help improve something already very special.

Clean and beautifully decorated room. Large candelit bath (unused) and very nice hot shower. Large and comfortable bed. Perfect WiFi. Area felt very safe. Really well located next to the two best parks (with amazing topiary) we saw in all of Ambato. The atmosphere on Sundays is particularly great. Just a 20 minute walk into central Ambato. Hosts are charming too. We would not consider staying anywhere else in Ambato.

The hotel is very low cost and meets the basic requirements.  The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.  There was no refrigerator or microwave in the room but that didn't matter since I'd planned to eat out anyway, and there were several restaurants within a few blocks.  You have to ask for room service, but the staff did an excellent job when service was requested.
Decent place but lots of noise near my room
 I asked for a room on the first floor because I have knee implants and a fused spine and climbing stairs is difficult for me.  This turned out to be a mistake as the three rooms on the first floor were next to the interior parking and very close to the reception desk.  There was a large door on the first floor that was closed during the night, from about 10 PM to 6:30 AM, but people were arriving all night, or trying to leave from the internal parking during the night, and the doorbell on the front door was set up to be very loud so that the receptionist could hear it wherever he was.  It rang so loudly that it would wake me up several times a night.  Ditto for the telephone on the reception desk.  The hotel seemed to be used by truck drivers who would leave very early in the morning, and they would load up their trucks in the indoor parking area.  One night, a truck prepared to leave at 2:20 AM and started using a lift gate to load some kind of metal objects, which were then pushed into the truck with lots of squealing noises.  Apparently one member of the truck crew didn't wake up on time, and rather than going to his door and waking him, the driver started honking the truck's horn repeatedly, which went on for 12 minutes until the offender showed up ready to hit the road.  Loud noise was so frequent during the night that it was hard to get much sleep.  I suspect things would be much better on the second or third floors, so the noise problem might not be a fair criticism of the entire hotel, but I'd certainly recommend avoiding a first floor room if possible.

The hotel is very low cost and meets the basic requirements.  The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.  There was no refrigerator or microwave in the room but that didn't matter since I'd planned to eat out anyway, and there were several restaurants within a few blocks.  You have to ask for room service, but the staff did an excellent job when service was requested.
Decent place but lots of noise near my room
 I asked for a room on the first floor because I have knee implants and a fused spine and climbing stairs is difficult for me.  This turned out to be a mistake as the three rooms on the first floor were next to the interior parking and very close to the reception desk.  There was a large door on the first floor that was closed during the night, from about 10 PM to 6:30 AM, but people were arriving all night, or trying to leave from the internal parking during the night, and the doorbell on the front door was set up to be very loud so that the receptionist could hear it wherever he was.  It rang so loudly that it would wake me up several times a night.  Ditto for the telephone on the reception desk.  The hotel seemed to be used by truck drivers who would leave very early in the morning, and they would load up their trucks in the indoor parking area.  One night, a truck prepared to leave at 2:20 AM and started using a lift gate to load some kind of metal objects, which were then pushed into the truck with lots of squealing noises.  Apparently one member of the truck crew didn't wake up on time, and rather than going to his door and waking him, the driver started honking the truck's horn repeatedly, which went on for 12 minutes until the offender showed up ready to hit the road.  Loud noise was so frequent during the night that it was hard to get much sleep.  I suspect things would be much better on the second or third floors, so the noise problem might not be a fair criticism of the entire hotel, but I'd certainly recommend avoiding a first floor room if possible.

nombreh_id: Cosmos Chill - Suite con jacuzzi y acuario
p_comentario:
This unique room is very special, full of creativity and positive energy.  The décor is calming and literally makes you smile.  Modern bathroom is clean and comfortable.  King-size bed was an added bonus.  Soaking tub was a relaxing way to spend some time watching a series, a movie or F1; LOVED the well-taken care of fish tanks and the "tub table" for our laptop and drinks.  Breakfast served to the room was DELICIOUS and very well presented.  There is a great japanese-style table in the room with cushions to sit on while eating.  Closet with hangers was appreciated.  Parking is a tight squeeze, but available inside the gated land, right outside the room.  Hosts answered all of our requests and questions immediately and It was really the perfect place to call home with a great, central location while we explored Ambato and the surrounding areas for a long weekend getaway.
A hidden gem in the middle of Ambato for a relaxing getaway while exploring the area.
 A few extra towels would have made a difference in our comfort level due to the amount of time spent in water in the room.  I would also suggest more ventilation in the bathroom.  That said, the fan in the room was a good way to keep air moving, especially when opening the main door.  A little more instruction on the cool electronic elements in the room would have helped us enjoy them more (large TV, Alexa, and home theater system).  Finally, the Internet, while good enough for sending messages, could not support Netflix or streaming on our devices and meant that we used a lot of data.  None of these issues prevented us from enjoying our weekend, though, and are only mentioned to help improve something already very special.

Clean and beautifully decorated room. Large candelit bath (unused) and very nice hot shower. Large and comfortable bed. Perfect WiFi. Area felt very safe. Really well located next to the two best parks (with amazing topiary) we saw in all of Ambato. The atmosphere on Sundays is particularly great. Just a 20 minute walk into central Ambato. Hosts are charming too. We would not consider staying anywhere else in Ambato.

It is very close to numerous tourist and historical sites, like famous churches, museums, and Independance Square, all within walking distance, and saving a lot of traffic jam if one were to be in the new town. 
Hotel assistant (Mr. Darwin) was very helpful and assisted in arranging for site tours by car, airport drop-off. The restaurant affiliated to the hotel was very homely and service was warm and kind, with candle light dinner and hot breakfast. Food was prepared with daily new purchase like meat and vegetables. Mr. Efren Lopez, driver of a hotel arranged car, was very polite and helpful, serving also as a tourist guide. He used phone tool for instant translation and communication with passengers and drove safely. His car service charged very fairly. He was able to make visitors feel comfortable. We took a photo with him at the airport for departure as a good keepsake and good memory. I would strongly recommend him as the best option (Mr. Darwin has his contact).
An advanturous trip at such high altitude. Walk and talk slowly in Quito and take deep breath!

 We were able to take hot shower only once. After that the “eco solar system” shut down or broke and we were left without hot water - really disappointing after full days of sightseeing.  All the signs about eco friendliness do not make sense since the sink was leaking  and we left the shower water running for 5-10 in hope of hot water (water wasted). We were told to let it run for 2-3 mins but then we realized something was wrong and we were out of luck for hot water for two days.  The staff was very friendly and helpful but the hot water problem was not theirs to resolve, especially on the weekend.

This boutique hotel in conveniently located close to “Old Quito”. The hotel was once the family home (uncle) of the current owner. The rooms are spacious and clean and the hotel is very secure. Hotel is in a good spot, competitvely priced but has some flaws.
 The internet is not great. Essentially had to sign in on our laptops several times and it would send us to Microsoft browser, then flake out a little while in, pretty frustrating system. The breakfast had some pros, like fresh juice and fruit, but the eggs were runny each morning and the bread/cheese choices were pretty plain. They keep one street entrance set of doors locked, so it was confusing for cabs and uber which would show up at an entrance and we were at the other side of the building. The windows are paper thin with poor seals, so you hear the party bus, dogs and bars pretty much through the night.

Poor internet, cold rooms, broken sauna, confused staf
 I booked and paid deluxe king room but when I came to the hotel they wanted to give me a standard room on the second floor. When I requested the room which I paid for they told me that they don't have free any king room. They offered me free breakfast as compensation, however when I come to breakfast the staff was telling me that I didn't pay for the breakfast and I had to explain the situation. The sauna was not working! The herb sauna was cold! The jacuzzi was hot but the jets were not working. Internet is super poor, on average 2mb/s.  I was already in this hotel twice and it's always very cold in the rooms, it's much warmer in the corridors or on the streets. The rooms are not soundproof, you can talk with your neighbor through the walls and the entrance door doesn't seal at all, there is a big gap at the bottom. I wouldn't go here the third time.

Относительно других отелей в Эквадоре цена в 8 долларов за ночь на мой взгляд близка к адекватной. Нет окна, поэтому душно и ощущение влажности в номере, плюс запахи краски.  Нет звукоизоляции, т.к. нет вентиляции и есть форточка в общие помещения.  Нет шампуня, полотенец. Номер не очень большой, основное пространство занимает кровать. В раковине холодная вода еле течёт. Ночью видел в номере тараканов, видимо из-за общей кухни. Для входа и выхода нужно чтобы открыли дверь в отель, не очень удобно. Хотя вроде немало освещения ощущение что находишься в подвале.

No me gustó absolutamente nada. El personal un desastre. El establecimiento un antro. El trato pésimo. No me volvería a quedar en este alojamiento ni gratis. La cama dura como una piedra....dormir en el suelo era más cómodo.

NOT recommended - bad customer service and terrible room
 I was very unhappy about my stay and would recommend against staying in this hostel. The hostel could be nice but it operates in quite an very amateur way. The volunteers are inexperienced in customer service and make many mistakes about rooms bookings.. 1- The room i was given was nothing like what was shown on the picture of booking.com. Instead, I had an old. unpleasant , basic and mouldy 'spare' room, which actually is listed in their reception as 'spare' suggesting this was not the normal room i should have been given. I assume a mistake was made and my room was given to someone else. If so i would have appreciated being advised and given the opportunity of taking a cheaper rate. 2- The volunteer from the Dominican Republic who opened the door when i arrived couldn't have been less welcoming. He was clearly unhappy that I arrived at 10pm and woke him up (even though i had advised of my late arrival several times via messages and they had said it was absolutely fine),. His attitude was unnecessarily unpleasant. He made me feel really unwelcome and uncomfortable. I work in tourism myself and would never dream of welcoming a guests this way. The new (younger ) volunteer was more welcoming and had more customer skills. 3 - I asked if a normal taxi (with a taxi meter) could be booked to the bus station for the next morning. They assured me it would be the case, but the next morning, a private (unofficial) taxi was in front of the door and refused to put the taxi meter saying he had been told to charge me $10 (this is twice the normal price) I shared this feedback with the hostel staff after my stay to give them the opportunity to get back to me but have heard nothing from them. I am left feeling very disappointed.

Las instalaciones muy bien distribuidas, el espacio bien mantenido y muy amplio. El lugar tiene una excelente vista y unas instalaciones que te permiten disfrutar con tranquilidad de un acceso privado al lago. La piscina y los hidromasajes en buenas condiciones, existe la facilidad de ordenar comida y bebidas en esa área. El restaurante de primera, muy buena comida. El lomo pimienta de lo mejor. El principal problema del establecimiento es el internet, quizá podrían invertir en repetidores para cada habitación; si bien es un sitio para salir de la rutina y estar en contacto con la naturaleza, debido a la falta de señal de las empresas telefónicas, es importante tener un buen internet por alguna emergencia. Otro problema es el pago, ya que me realizaron 3 cuentas, una por la estadía y servicios del hotel, otra por el consumo en la piscina y otra por el consumo en el restaurante, esto genera que el check out tome un tiempo considerable. Ambas cosas pueden mejorar. Lo demás todo excelente

Il a très bien su me renseigner pour les excursions à pratiquer dans les environs et m’a vraiment donné l’envie de prolonger mon séjour.
L’établissement sert de typiques et délicieux petits déjeuners et dîners. Les lits sont faits chaque jour. Le soir, on allume un bon feu de cheminée. L’ambiance est détendue et familiale. Pas d’ordinateur fixe à disposition de la clientèle et le Wifi semble ne pas fonctionner la nuit.
La calidez de los dueños Me encantó todo

An gem in La Esperanza

Recomendadísimo. Esta es definitivamente una perla escondida, de esas muy inusuales que no se merecen menos que una puntuación perfecta. 
La casa, habitaciones y lugares comunales son muy bonitas y acogedoras, muy buen decorado, artístico sin ser estrambótico, y el servicio (Cristhian en mi caso, más el personal de limpieza y del restaurante) fueron muy amables, eficientes y de increíble ayuda. 
La ubicación es buenísima también, cerca de todo, especialmente para alguien que no conocía la ciudad y tenía poco tiempo para explorarla. 
Mi estadía en Loja se extendió por una noche más, y fue obvio que no habría mejor lugar para hospedarme en la ciudad otra vez.

The hotel is very low cost and meets the basic requirements.  The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.  There was no refrigerator or microwave in the room but that didn't matter since I'd planned to eat out anyway, and there were several restaurants within a few blocks.  You have to ask for room service, but the staff did an excellent job when service was requested.
Decent place but lots of noise near my room
 I asked for a room on the first floor because I have knee implants and a fused spine and climbing stairs is difficult for me.  This turned out to be a mistake as the three rooms on the first floor were next to the interior parking and very close to the reception desk.  There was a large door on the first floor that was closed during the night, from about 10 PM to 6:30 AM, but people were arriving all night, or trying to leave from the internal parking during the night, and the doorbell on the front door was set up to be very loud so that the receptionist could hear it wherever he was.  It rang so loudly that it would wake me up several times a night.  Ditto for the telephone on the reception desk.  The hotel seemed to be used by truck drivers who would leave very early in the morning, and they would load up their trucks in the indoor parking area.  One night, a truck prepared to leave at 2:20 AM and started using a lift gate to load some kind of metal objects, which were then pushed into the truck with lots of squealing noises.  Apparently one member of the truck crew didn't wake up on time, and rather than going to his door and waking him, the driver started honking the truck's horn repeatedly, which went on for 12 minutes until the offender showed up ready to hit the road.  Loud noise was so frequent during the night that it was hard to get much sleep.  I suspect things would be much better on the second or third floors, so the noise problem might not be a fair criticism of the entire hotel, but I'd certainly recommend avoiding a first floor room if possible.

p_comentario: Leuke suite. Heerlijke jacuzzi. Personeel erg behulpzaam en flexibel met uitchecken. Grote tv met opties voor YouTube en Netflix! :) Jammer dat beamer het alleen via WiFi doet, gezien niet iedereen mobiele data heeft. Ontbijt zou top zijn met optie voor thee ipv koffie.

nombreh_id: Cosmos Chill - Suite con jacuzzi y acuario
p_comentario:
This unique room is very special, full of creativity and positive energy.  The décor is calming and literally makes you smile.  Modern bathroom is clean and comfortable.  King-size bed was an added bonus.  Soaking tub was a relaxing way to spend some time watching a series, a movie or F1; LOVED the well-taken care of fish tanks and the "tub table" for our laptop and drinks.  Breakfast served to the room was DELICIOUS and very well presented.  There is a great japanese-style table in the room with cushions to sit on while eating.  Closet with hangers was appreciated.  Parking is a tight squeeze, but available inside the gated land, right outside the room.  Hosts answered all of our requests and questions immediately and It was really the perfect place to call home with a great, central location while we explored Ambato and the surrounding areas for a long weekend getaway.
A hidden gem in the middle of Ambato for a relaxing getaway while exploring the area.
 A few extra towels would have made a difference in our comfort level due to the amount of time spent in water in the room.  I would also suggest more ventilation in the bathroom.  That said, the fan in the room was a good way to keep air moving, especially when opening the main door.  A little more instruction on the cool electronic elements in the room would have helped us enjoy them more (large TV, Alexa, and home theater system).  Finally, the Internet, while good enough for sending messages, could not support Netflix or streaming on our devices and meant that we used a lot of data.  None of these issues prevented us from enjoying our weekend, though, and are only mentioned to help improve something already very special.

p_comentario:
Clean and beautifully decorated room. Large candelit bath (unused) and very nice hot shower. Large and comfortable bed. Perfect WiFi. Area felt very safe. Really well located next to the two best parks (with amazing topiary) we saw in all of Ambato. The atmosphere on Sundays is particularly great. Just a 20 minute walk into central Ambato. Hosts are charming too. We would not consider staying anywhere else in Ambato.

Recomendadísimo. Esta es definitivamente una perla escondida, de esas muy inusuales que no se merecen menos que una puntuación perfecta. 
La casa, habitaciones y lugares comunales son muy bonitas y acogedoras, muy buen decorado, artístico sin ser estrambótico, y el servicio (Cristhian en mi caso, más el personal de limpieza y del restaurante) fueron muy amables, eficientes y de increíble ayuda. 
La ubicación es buenísima también, cerca de todo, especialmente para alguien que no conocía la ciudad y tenía poco tiempo para explorarla. 
Mi estadía en Loja se extendió por una noche más, y fue obvio que no habría mejor lugar para hospedarme en la ciudad otra vez.

The hotel is very low cost and meets the basic requirements.  The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.  There was no refrigerator or microwave in the room but that didn't matter since I'd planned to eat out anyway, and there were several restaurants within a few blocks.  You have to ask for room service, but the staff did an excellent job when service was requested.
Decent place but lots of noise near my room
 I asked for a room on the first floor because I have knee implants and a fused spine and climbing stairs is difficult for me.  This turned out to be a mistake as the three rooms on the first floor were next to the interior parking and very close to the reception desk.  There was a large door on the first floor that was closed during the night, from about 10 PM to 6:30 AM, but people were arriving all night, or trying to leave from the internal parking during the night, and the doorbell on the front door was set up to be very loud so that the receptionist could hear it wherever he was.  It rang so loudly that it would wake me up several times a night.  Ditto for the telephone on the reception desk.  The hotel seemed to be used by truck drivers who would leave very early in the morning, and they would load up their trucks in the indoor parking area.  One night, a truck prepared to leave at 2:20 AM and started using a lift gate to load some kind of metal objects, which were then pushed into the truck with lots of squealing noises.  Apparently one member of the truck crew didn't wake up on time, and rather than going to his door and waking him, the driver started honking the truck's horn repeatedly, which went on for 12 minutes until the offender showed up ready to hit the road.  Loud noise was so frequent during the night that it was hard to get much sleep.  I suspect things would be much better on the second or third floors, so the noise problem might not be a fair criticism of the entire hotel, but I'd certainly recommend avoiding a first floor room if possible.

p_comentario: Leuke suite. Heerlijke jacuzzi. Personeel erg behulpzaam en flexibel met uitchecken. Grote tv met opties voor YouTube en Netflix! :) Jammer dat beamer het alleen via WiFi doet, gezien niet iedereen mobiele data heeft. Ontbijt zou top zijn met optie voor thee ipv koffie.

nombreh_id: Cosmos Chill - Suite con jacuzzi y acuario
p_comentario:
This unique room is very special, full of creativity and positive energy.  The décor is calming and literally makes you smile.  Modern bathroom is clean and comfortable.  King-size bed was an added bonus.  Soaking tub was a relaxing way to spend some time watching a series, a movie or F1; LOVED the well-taken care of fish tanks and the "tub table" for our laptop and drinks.  Breakfast served to the room was DELICIOUS and very well presented.  There is a great japanese-style table in the room with cushions to sit on while eating.  Closet with hangers was appreciated.  Parking is a tight squeeze, but available inside the gated land, right outside the room.  Hosts answered all of our requests and questions immediately and It was really the perfect place to call home with a great, central location while we explored Ambato and the surrounding areas for a long weekend getaway.
A hidden gem in the middle of Ambato for a relaxing getaway while exploring the area.
 A few extra towels would have made a difference in our comfort level due to the amount of time spent in water in the room.  I would also suggest more ventilation in the bathroom.  That said, the fan in the room was a good way to keep air moving, especially when opening the main door.  A little more instruction on the cool electronic elements in the room would have helped us enjoy them more (large TV, Alexa, and home theater system).  Finally, the Internet, while good enough for sending messages, could not support Netflix or streaming on our devices and meant that we used a lot of data.  None of these issues prevented us from enjoying our weekend, though, and are only mentioned to help improve something already very special.

p_comentario:
Clean and beautifully decorated room. Large candelit bath (unused) and very nice hot shower. Large and comfortable bed. Perfect WiFi. Area felt very safe. Really well located next to the two best parks (with amazing topiary) we saw in all of Ambato. The atmosphere on Sundays is particularly great. Just a 20 minute walk into central Ambato. Hosts are charming too. We would not consider staying anywhere else in Ambato.

It is very close to numerous tourist and historical sites, like famous churches, museums, and Independance Square, all within walking distance, and saving a lot of traffic jam if one were to be in the new town. 
Hotel assistant (Mr. Darwin) was very helpful and assisted in arranging for site tours by car, airport drop-off. The restaurant affiliated to the hotel was very homely and service was warm and kind, with candle light dinner and hot breakfast. Food was prepared with daily new purchase like meat and vegetables. Mr. Efren Lopez, driver of a hotel arranged car, was very polite and helpful, serving also as a tourist guide. He used phone tool for instant translation and communication with passengers and drove safely. His car service charged very fairly. He was able to make visitors feel comfortable. We took a photo with him at the airport for departure as a good keepsake and good memory. I would strongly recommend him as the best option (Mr. Darwin has his contact).
An advanturous trip at such high altitude. Walk and talk slowly in Quito and take deep breath!
 The bathroom does not have a ventilator, nor a TV in the room (for World Cup 2022). All power sockets seemed to be loose for phone chargers. Sound proof was poor and one could hear chatting in other rooms or common areas.

 We were able to take hot shower only once. After that the “eco solar system” shut down or broke and we were left without hot water - really disappointing after full days of sightseeing.  All the signs about eco friendliness do not make sense since the sink was leaking  and we left the shower water running for 5-10 in hope of hot water (water wasted). We were told to let it run for 2-3 mins but then we realized something was wrong and we were out of luck for hot water for two days.  The staff was very friendly and helpful but the hot water problem was not theirs to resolve, especially on the weekend.

 The internet is not great. Essentially had to sign in on our laptops several times and it would send us to Microsoft browser, then flake out a little while in, pretty frustrating system. The breakfast had some pros, like fresh juice and fruit, but the eggs were runny each morning and the bread/cheese choices were pretty plain. They keep one street entrance set of doors locked, so it was confusing for cabs and uber which would show up at an entrance and we were at the other side of the building. The windows are paper thin with poor seals, so you hear the party bus, dogs and bars pretty much through the night.

 I booked and paid deluxe king room but when I came to the hotel they wanted to give me a standard room on the second floor. When I requested the room which I paid for they told me that they don't have free any king room. They offered me free breakfast as compensation, however when I come to breakfast the staff was telling me that I didn't pay for the breakfast and I had to explain the situation. The sauna was not working! The herb sauna was cold! The jacuzzi was hot but the jets were not working. Internet is super poor, on average 2mb/s.  I was already in this hotel twice and it's always very cold in the rooms, it's much warmer in the corridors or on the streets. The rooms are not soundproof, you can talk with your neighbor through the walls and the entrance door doesn't seal at all, there is a big gap at the bottom. I wouldn't go here the third time.

Относительно других отелей в Эквадоре цена в 8 долларов за ночь на мой взгляд близка к адекватной. Нет окна, поэтому душно и ощущение влажности в номере, плюс запахи краски.  Нет звукоизоляции, т.к. нет вентиляции и есть форточка в общие помещения.  Нет шампуня, полотенец. Номер не очень большой, основное пространство занимает кровать. В раковине холодная вода еле течёт. Ночью видел в номере тараканов, видимо из-за общей кухни. Для входа и выхода нужно чтобы открыли дверь в отель, не очень удобно. Хотя вроде немало освещения ощущение что находишься в подвале.

No me gustó absolutamente nada. El personal un desastre. El establecimiento un antro. El trato pésimo. No me volvería a quedar en este alojamiento ni gratis. La cama dura como una piedra....dormir en el suelo era más cómodo.

NOT recommended - bad customer service and terrible room
 I was very unhappy about my stay and would recommend against staying in this hostel. The hostel could be nice but it operates in quite an very amateur way. The volunteers are inexperienced in customer service and make many mistakes about rooms bookings.. 1- The room i was given was nothing like what was shown on the picture of booking.com. Instead, I had an old. unpleasant , basic and mouldy 'spare' room, which actually is listed in their reception as 'spare' suggesting this was not the normal room i should have been given. I assume a mistake was made and my room was given to someone else. If so i would have appreciated being advised and given the opportunity of taking a cheaper rate. 2- The volunteer from the Dominican Republic who opened the door when i arrived couldn't have been less welcoming. He was clearly unhappy that I arrived at 10pm and woke him up (even though i had advised of my late arrival several times via messages and they had said it was absolutely fine),. His attitude was unnecessarily unpleasant. He made me feel really unwelcome and uncomfortable. I work in tourism myself and would never dream of welcoming a guests this way. The new (younger ) volunteer was more welcoming and had more customer skills. 3 - I asked if a normal taxi (with a taxi meter) could be booked to the bus station for the next morning. They assured me it would be the case, but the next morning, a private (unofficial) taxi was in front of the door and refused to put the taxi meter saying he had been told to charge me $10 (this is twice the normal price) I shared this feedback with the hostel staff after my stay to give them the opportunity to get back to me but have heard nothing from them. I am left feeling very disappointed.

The hotel is very low cost and meets the basic requirements.  The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.  There was no refrigerator or microwave in the room but that didn't matter since I'd planned to eat out anyway, and there were several restaurants within a few blocks.  You have to ask for room service, but the staff did an excellent job when service was requested.
Decent place but lots of noise near my room
 I asked for a room on the first floor because I have knee implants and a fused spine and climbing stairs is difficult for me.  This turned out to be a mistake as the three rooms on the first floor were next to the interior parking and very close to the reception desk.  There was a large door on the first floor that was closed during the night, from about 10 PM to 6:30 AM, but people were arriving all night, or trying to leave from the internal parking during the night, and the doorbell on the front door was set up to be very loud so that the receptionist could hear it wherever he was.  It rang so loudly that it would wake me up several times a night.  Ditto for the telephone on the reception desk.  The hotel seemed to be used by truck drivers who would leave very early in the morning, and they would load up their trucks in the indoor parking area.  One night, a truck prepared to leave at 2:20 AM and started using a lift gate to load some kind of metal objects, which were then pushed into the truck with lots of squealing noises.  Apparently one member of the truck crew didn't wake up on time, and rather than going to his door and waking him, the driver started honking the truck's horn repeatedly, which went on for 12 minutes until the offender showed up ready to hit the road.  Loud noise was so frequent during the night that it was hard to get much sleep.  I suspect things would be much better on the second or third floors, so the noise problem might not be a fair criticism of the entire hotel, but I'd certainly recommend avoiding a first floor room if possible.

The hotel is very low cost and meets the basic requirements.  The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.  There was no refrigerator or microwave in the room but that didn't matter since I'd planned to eat out anyway, and there were several restaurants within a few blocks.  You have to ask for room service, but the staff did an excellent job when service was requested.
Decent place but lots of noise near my room
 I asked for a room on the first floor because I have knee implants and a fused spine and climbing stairs is difficult for me.  This turned out to be a mistake as the three rooms on the first floor were next to the interior parking and very close to the reception desk.  There was a large door on the first floor that was closed during the night, from about 10 PM to 6:30 AM, but people were arriving all night, or trying to leave from the internal parking during the night, and the doorbell on the front door was set up to be very loud so that the receptionist could hear it wherever he was.  It rang so loudly that it would wake me up several times a night.  Ditto for the telephone on the reception desk.  The hotel seemed to be used by truck drivers who would leave very early in the morning, and they would load up their trucks in the indoor parking area.  One night, a truck prepared to leave at 2:20 AM and started using a lift gate to load some kind of metal objects, which were then pushed into the truck with lots of squealing noises.  Apparently one member of the truck crew didn't wake up on time, and rather than going to his door and waking him, the driver started honking the truck's horn repeatedly, which went on for 12 minutes until the offender showed up ready to hit the road.  Loud noise was so frequent during the night that it was hard to get much sleep.  I suspect things would be much better on the second or third floors, so the noise problem might not be a fair criticism of the entire hotel, but I'd certainly recommend avoiding a first floor room if possible.

nombreh_id: Cosmos Chill - Suite con jacuzzi y acuario
p_comentario:
This unique room is very special, full of creativity and positive energy.  The décor is calming and literally makes you smile.  Modern bathroom is clean and comfortable.  King-size bed was an added bonus.  Soaking tub was a relaxing way to spend some time watching a series, a movie or F1; LOVED the well-taken care of fish tanks and the "tub table" for our laptop and drinks.  Breakfast served to the room was DELICIOUS and very well presented.  There is a great japanese-style table in the room with cushions to sit on while eating.  Closet with hangers was appreciated.  Parking is a tight squeeze, but available inside the gated land, right outside the room.  Hosts answered all of our requests and questions immediately and It was really the perfect place to call home with a great, central location while we explored Ambato and the surrounding areas for a long weekend getaway.
A hidden gem in the middle of Ambato for a relaxing getaway while exploring the area.
 A few extra towels would have made a difference in our comfort level due to the amount of time spent in water in the room.  I would also suggest more ventilation in the bathroom.  That said, the fan in the room was a good way to keep air moving, especially when opening the main door.  A little more instruction on the cool electronic elements in the room would have helped us enjoy them more (large TV, Alexa, and home theater system).  Finally, the Internet, while good enough for sending messages, could not support Netflix or streaming on our devices and meant that we used a lot of data.  None of these issues prevented us from enjoying our weekend, though, and are only mentioned to help improve something already very special.

Clean and beautifully decorated room. Large candelit bath (unused) and very nice hot shower. Large and comfortable bed. Perfect WiFi. Area felt very safe. Really well located next to the two best parks (with amazing topiary) we saw in all of Ambato. The atmosphere on Sundays is particularly great. Just a 20 minute walk into central Ambato. Hosts are charming too. We would not consider staying anywhere else in Ambato.

The hotel is very low cost and meets the basic requirements.  The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.  There was no refrigerator or microwave in the room but that didn't matter since I'd planned to eat out anyway, and there were several restaurants within a few blocks.  You have to ask for room service, but the staff did an excellent job when service was requested.
Decent place but lots of noise near my room
 I asked for a room on the first floor because I have knee implants and a fused spine and climbing stairs is difficult for me.  This turned out to be a mistake as the three rooms on the first floor were next to the interior parking and very close to the reception desk.  There was a large door on the first floor that was closed during the night, from about 10 PM to 6:30 AM, but people were arriving all night, or trying to leave from the internal parking during the night, and the doorbell on the front door was set up to be very loud so that the receptionist could hear it wherever he was.  It rang so loudly that it would wake me up several times a night.  Ditto for the telephone on the reception desk.  The hotel seemed to be used by truck drivers who would leave very early in the morning, and they would load up their trucks in the indoor parking area.  One night, a truck prepared to leave at 2:20 AM and started using a lift gate to load some kind of metal objects, which were then pushed into the truck with lots of squealing noises.  Apparently one member of the truck crew didn't wake up on time, and rather than going to his door and waking him, the driver started honking the truck's horn repeatedly, which went on for 12 minutes until the offender showed up ready to hit the road.  Loud noise was so frequent during the night that it was hard to get much sleep.  I suspect things would be much better on the second or third floors, so the noise problem might not be a fair criticism of the entire hotel, but I'd certainly recommend avoiding a first floor room if possible.

The hotel is very low cost and meets the basic requirements.  The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.  There was no refrigerator or microwave in the room but that didn't matter since I'd planned to eat out anyway, and there were several restaurants within a few blocks.  You have to ask for room service, but the staff did an excellent job when service was requested.
Decent place but lots of noise near my room
 I asked for a room on the first floor because I have knee implants and a fused spine and climbing stairs is difficult for me.  This turned out to be a mistake as the three rooms on the first floor were next to the interior parking and very close to the reception desk.  There was a large door on the first floor that was closed during the night, from about 10 PM to 6:30 AM, but people were arriving all night, or trying to leave from the internal parking during the night, and the doorbell on the front door was set up to be very loud so that the receptionist could hear it wherever he was.  It rang so loudly that it would wake me up several times a night.  Ditto for the telephone on the reception desk.  The hotel seemed to be used by truck drivers who would leave very early in the morning, and they would load up their trucks in the indoor parking area.  One night, a truck prepared to leave at 2:20 AM and started using a lift gate to load some kind of metal objects, which were then pushed into the truck with lots of squealing noises.  Apparently one member of the truck crew didn't wake up on time, and rather than going to his door and waking him, the driver started honking the truck's horn repeatedly, which went on for 12 minutes until the offender showed up ready to hit the road.  Loud noise was so frequent during the night that it was hard to get much sleep.  I suspect things would be much better on the second or third floors, so the noise problem might not be a fair criticism of the entire hotel, but I'd certainly recommend avoiding a first floor room if possible.

nombreh_id: Cosmos Chill - Suite con jacuzzi y acuario
p_comentario:
This unique room is very special, full of creativity and positive energy.  The décor is calming and literally makes you smile.  Modern bathroom is clean and comfortable.  King-size bed was an added bonus.  Soaking tub was a relaxing way to spend some time watching a series, a movie or F1; LOVED the well-taken care of fish tanks and the "tub table" for our laptop and drinks.  Breakfast served to the room was DELICIOUS and very well presented.  There is a great japanese-style table in the room with cushions to sit on while eating.  Closet with hangers was appreciated.  Parking is a tight squeeze, but available inside the gated land, right outside the room.  Hosts answered all of our requests and questions immediately and It was really the perfect place to call home with a great, central location while we explored Ambato and the surrounding areas for a long weekend getaway.
A hidden gem in the middle of Ambato for a relaxing getaway while exploring the area.
 A few extra towels would have made a difference in our comfort level due to the amount of time spent in water in the room.  I would also suggest more ventilation in the bathroom.  That said, the fan in the room was a good way to keep air moving, especially when opening the main door.  A little more instruction on the cool electronic elements in the room would have helped us enjoy them more (large TV, Alexa, and home theater system).  Finally, the Internet, while good enough for sending messages, could not support Netflix or streaming on our devices and meant that we used a lot of data.  None of these issues prevented us from enjoying our weekend, though, and are only mentioned to help improve something already very special.

Clean and beautifully decorated room. Large candelit bath (unused) and very nice hot shower. Large and comfortable bed. Perfect WiFi. Area felt very safe. Really well located next to the two best parks (with amazing topiary) we saw in all of Ambato. The atmosphere on Sundays is particularly great. Just a 20 minute walk into central Ambato. Hosts are charming too. We would not consider staying anywhere else in Ambato.

It is very close to numerous tourist and historical sites, like famous churches, museums, and Independance Square, all within walking distance, and saving a lot of traffic jam if one were to be in the new town. 
Hotel assistant (Mr. Darwin) was very helpful and assisted in arranging for site tours by car, airport drop-off. The restaurant affiliated to the hotel was very homely and service was warm and kind, with candle light dinner and hot breakfast. Food was prepared with daily new purchase like meat and vegetables. Mr. Efren Lopez, driver of a hotel arranged car, was very polite and helpful, serving also as a tourist guide. He used phone tool for instant translation and communication with passengers and drove safely. His car service charged very fairly. He was able to make visitors feel comfortable. We took a photo with him at the airport for departure as a good keepsake and good memory. I would strongly recommend him as the best option (Mr. Darwin has his contact).
An advanturous trip at such high altitude. Walk and talk slowly in Quito and take deep breath!

 We were able to take hot shower only once. After that the “eco solar system” shut down or broke and we were left without hot water - really disappointing after full days of sightseeing.  All the signs about eco friendliness do not make sense since the sink was leaking  and we left the shower water running for 5-10 in hope of hot water (water wasted). We were told to let it run for 2-3 mins but then we realized something was wrong and we were out of luck for hot water for two days.  The staff was very friendly and helpful but the hot water problem was not theirs to resolve, especially on the weekend.

This boutique hotel in conveniently located close to “Old Quito”. The hotel was once the family home (uncle) of the current owner. The rooms are spacious and clean and the hotel is very secure. The location was good, with lots of walking areas available. Pretty much centre of the city  (which is very long) and not quick to get anywhere. Our rooms were always clean we were pleasantly greeted by all staff.
Hotel is in a good spot, competitvely priced but has some flaws.
 The internet is not great. Essentially had to sign in on our laptops several times and it would send us to Microsoft browser, then flake out a little while in, pretty frustrating system. The breakfast had some pros, like fresh juice and fruit, but the eggs were runny each morning and the bread/cheese choices were pretty plain. They keep one street entrance set of doors locked, so it was confusing for cabs and uber which would show up at an entrance and we were at the other side of the building. The windows are paper thin with poor seals, so you hear the party bus, dogs and bars pretty much through the night.

Poor internet, cold rooms, broken sauna, confused staf
 I booked and paid deluxe king room but when I came to the hotel they wanted to give me a standard room on the second floor. When I requested the room which I paid for they told me that they don't have free any king room. They offered me free breakfast as compensation, however when I come to breakfast the staff was telling me that I didn't pay for the breakfast and I had to explain the situation. The sauna was not working! The herb sauna was cold! The jacuzzi was hot but the jets were not working. Internet is super poor, on average 2mb/s.  I was already in this hotel twice and it's always very cold in the rooms, it's much warmer in the corridors or on the streets. The rooms are not soundproof, you can talk with your neighbor through the walls and the entrance door doesn't seal at all, there is a big gap at the bottom. I wouldn't go here the third time.

Отличное расположение, рядом остановки транспорта, кафе, магазины. Центр города, до всего легко дойти пешком или доехать.

Относительно других отелей в Эквадоре цена в 8 долларов за ночь на мой взгляд близка к адекватной. Нет окна, поэтому душно и ощущение влажности в номере, плюс запахи краски.  Нет звукоизоляции, т.к. нет вентиляции и есть форточка в общие помещения.  Нет шампуня, полотенец. Номер не очень большой, основное пространство занимает кровать. В раковине холодная вода еле течёт. Ночью видел в номере тараканов, видимо из-за общей кухни. Для входа и выхода нужно чтобы открыли дверь в отель, не очень удобно. Хотя вроде немало освещения ощущение что находишься в подвале.

No me gustó absolutamente nada. El personal un desastre. El establecimiento un antro. El trato pésimo. No me volvería a quedar en este alojamiento ni gratis. La cama dura como una piedra....dormir en el suelo era más cómodo.

NOT recommended - bad customer service and terrible room
 I was very unhappy about my stay and would recommend against staying in this hostel. The hostel could be nice but it operates in quite an very amateur way. The volunteers are inexperienced in customer service and make many mistakes about rooms bookings.. 1- The room i was given was nothing like what was shown on the picture of booking.com. Instead, I had an old. unpleasant , basic and mouldy 'spare' room, which actually is listed in their reception as 'spare' suggesting this was not the normal room i should have been given. I assume a mistake was made and my room was given to someone else. If so i would have appreciated being advised and given the opportunity of taking a cheaper rate. 2- The volunteer from the Dominican Republic who opened the door when i arrived couldn't have been less welcoming. He was clearly unhappy that I arrived at 10pm and woke him up (even though i had advised of my late arrival several times via messages and they had said it was absolutely fine),. His attitude was unnecessarily unpleasant. He made me feel really unwelcome and uncomfortable. I work in tourism myself and would never dream of welcoming a guests this way. The new (younger ) volunteer was more welcoming and had more customer skills. 3 - I asked if a normal taxi (with a taxi meter) could be booked to the bus station for the next morning. They assured me it would be the case, but the next morning, a private (unofficial) taxi was in front of the door and refused to put the taxi meter saying he had been told to charge me $10 (this is twice the normal price) I shared this feedback with the hostel staff after my stay to give them the opportunity to get back to me but have heard nothing from them. I am left feeling very disappointed.

Las instalaciones muy bien distribuidas, el espacio bien mantenido y muy amplio. El lugar tiene una excelente vista y unas instalaciones que te permiten disfrutar con tranquilidad de un acceso privado al lago. La piscina y los hidromasajes en buenas condiciones, existe la facilidad de ordenar comida y bebidas en esa área. El restaurante de primera, muy buena comida. El lomo pimienta de lo mejor. El principal problema del establecimiento es el internet, quizá podrían invertir en repetidores para cada habitación; si bien es un sitio para salir de la rutina y estar en contacto con la naturaleza, debido a la falta de señal de las empresas telefónicas, es importante tener un buen internet por alguna emergencia. Otro problema es el pago, ya que me realizaron 3 cuentas, una por la estadía y servicios del hotel, otra por el consumo en la piscina y otra por el consumo en el restaurante, esto genera que el check out tome un tiempo considerable. Ambas cosas pueden mejorar. Lo demás todo excelente

I came to this hostel and ended up at that moment the only guest staying there. A bit out of the way and tired, I didn't expect it to be the wonderful ecperience it was. All credit goes to Emerson. He's a beautiful and amazing human being I spent hours speaking with about everything and he did his absolute best to make me comfortable, not as a business but as a friend. The environment and facilities fhemselves were really creative and cool. With a group of people, I can imagine it being a place you could get stuck at!
Exceptional

Gastgeber sehr freundlich hilfsbereit entgegen kommend. Gute Lage fuer Touren auf Imbambura und Cubilche.

Awesome place, nice people , recommended. Hermoso hostal , buena gente ! Todo bonito ++

J’ai été impressionné par la chaleur de l’accueil du tenancier, Rodman, qui semble connaître tout le monde dans le village et qui m’a spontanément invité à prendre un verre chez son oncle. Il a très bien su me renseigner pour les excursions à pratiquer dans les environs et m’a vraiment donné l’envie de prolonger mon séjour.
L’établissement sert de typiques et délicieux petits déjeuners et dîners. Les lits sont faits chaque jour. Le soir, on allume un bon feu de cheminée. L’ambiance est détendue et familiale. Pas d’ordinateur fixe à disposition de la clientèle et le Wifi semble ne pas fonctionner la nuit.
La calidez de los dueños Me encantó todo

This place is an up-and-coming community of open-minded, warm hearted, incredible hosts that will not only make you feel at home but will guide you through adventures you might never find on your own.
An gem in La Esperanza
 I’m extremely sensitive to mold and I did detect some in the bedroom, but that didn’t really affect our stay or our positive review of this place! It’s a very special hostel!
Sehr nette Besitzer und schönes Ambiente. Frühstück und ein warmes Abendessen waren beim Preis mit inbegriffen.

las sábanas, de algodón muy suaves, muy confortables que daban una sensación de estar sobre algodón ☺️.. También que se preocupan de los gatitos abandonados.. tienen en un pequeño refugio!!! mejorar el desayuno, mas opciones de desayuno

Desayuno muuuuy bueno. Le doy unos puntos menos por qué al querer pagar con tarjeta te quieren cobrar más. El personal indica que es por qué el servicio "le cobra al cliente un porcentaje de la transacción" y no, el cliente no es el que usa el servicio para su negocio, lo usa el hospedaje, con lo cual se supone que sus precios ya están acomodados para todos esos "gastos" el resto todo bien.

🙂 Die Hilfsbereitschaft des jungen Herren an der Reception! Sehr sehr sehr freundlicher & hilfsbereiter junger Mann 🙏🏼🙏🏼🙏🏼!
🙂 Der Preis ist wirklich sehr fair und die Ausstattung ziemlich neu und modern.
🙂 WiFi war sehr gut! ☹️ Leider war die Bettwäsche nicht sauber, es hatte fremde Haare drauf und es roch nicht nach frischer Wäsche. Am nächsten Tag meldete ich dies und sie wollten das Bett neu beziehen, was leider auch nicht geschah. Erst als ich das Kärtchen mit der Bitte um Bettwäsche-Wechsel auflegte wurde diese endlich gewechselt. Schade, dass ich nur während einer von 3 Nächten in einem sauberen Bett schlafen konnte. Sauberkeit & Hygiene hat meines Erachtens rein gar nichts mit Sternen oder teurem Preis zu tun. ☹️ Die Toilettenspülung funktionierte nicht richtig. Nicht schön, 5x spülen zu müssen und trotzdem geht es nicht richtig ab.   ☹️ Keinen Abfalleimer im Zimmer, nur der winzig kleine Eimer im Badezimmer, worin man das gebrauchte Toilettenpapier entsorgt. ☹️ Das Frühstück: Rührei, 2x Brötchen, 1x Kaffee (schwarz), Butter & Marmelade, 1x Fruchtsaft (aus der Verpackung und ziemlich süss) war sehr eintönig und einfach. Ich wurde auch nicht gefragt, ob ich lieber Tee hätte oder etwas Milch, oder ein Spiegelei/gekochtes Ei etc. Eine Früchteschale und dafür etwas weniger Brot wäre toll gewesen!

Las habitaciones son lindas, limpias y muy organizadas. Puede disfrutar de mi serie, ya que teniamos Netflix disponible. Las camas son muy comodas y el personal fue maravilloso incluso nos permitieron dejar las maletas. El agua caliente no lo era, el desayuno podría incluir una fruta.

Tiene una buena ubicación La ducha estaba sucia y en un momento se salió. Nunca cambiaron las sábanas. Solo pusieron un cuarto de papel higiénico y nunca pusieron otro. Son cosas que uno espera como básicas y no que uno tenga que estar pidiendo al hotel. Cuando iba a hacer el check out (porque quería decirles de la mejor manera lo que deben mejorar) no hubo nadie en recepción, tuve que dejar la llave sobre el mostrador. Pésimo servicio en verdad.

Super helpful and friendly host i booked last minute and arrived late at night. 
Which can be a pain for guest houses but they were really very welcoming and got me straight to bed.
My room was simple but clean and bigger than most budget rooms. I was just doing a sleep over between buses and it was ideal for that.
They also ordered me a can the next day if you stand your ground with the drivers its 2 dollars from the Bus Terminal.
Fewmin walk from the beach and there us a great specialist coffee shop near by.
Perfect City Stop

The service was number 1 for me. Helped me find cheap and efficient ways to travel around, booked a driver for me to the station when I was leaving, brought me water when I was unwell and allowed me to use a room early before my check in time because I wasn’t well… incredible!
Service service service!

Jham the owner was extremely helpful during my stay as was his wife and the rest of the staff. We stayed one night at the hotel to be close to the airport for a flight out early the next morning. The location was 5 minutes away; the hotel had a shuttle hourly which made it very convenient (and they also were there to pick us up when we landed.).

I spent two days in Guayaquil. The hotel is close to the airport and a shuttle was waiting for me at the exit of the airport. Every thing was fine including the foods at the hotel restaurant , I recommend   .
Nice stay

El desayuno es rico y variado estilo Bufette con opciones de gastronomia local e internacional. EL parqueadero siempre estuvo disponible. En las noches de fin de semana se escucha el ruido de los eventos sociales de las salas de recepción. Llevar unos buenos tapones.

La cama bastante cómoda, el parqueadero al cruzar la calle muy innovador, interesante y maneja con cuidado al vehículo. La piscina es bonita pero podría tener mayor iluminación. Las tarifas en booking no están actualizadas (pues no quiero pensar que estan mal a propósito) pero al hacer la reserva el valor por habitación y el cálculo de impuestos está totalmente en discordancia con lo que se termina pagando en el lugar. Deberían dar a conocer de manera transparente, TODOS los impuestos que recargan al costo de la habitación, o al menos poner en la página un valor más aproximado al real. Los señores de la recepción, cuando les pedimos una explicación en el check-in, estaban reacios a darla y con una actitud no muy buena. El precio del desayuno también me parece un poco excesivo para las opciones que oferta el buffet, es un desayuno que no debería costar mas de $12 dólares. Estan los señores meseros que sirven el café que un día nos ignoró por completo, tuvimos que ir a perseguirlo para pedirle que nos ayude con el café; una de mis amigas pidió un té que nunca le llegó. Son situaciones que uno no espera en un hotel de esta categoría y mas por el precio que nos terminaron recargando.

Las instalaciones muy cómodas, todo el personal del hotel fue muy atento y amable, la piscina a buena temperatura el buffet del desayuno rico y variado. La atención en el restaurante pudiera ser mejor, el personal del desayuno muy atento, el de la hora de almuerzo un poco descuidados en ocasiones.
El personal amable y la comida muy buena La cama creo ya tiene su tiempo

Nice hotel, but got price gouged.
 I have stayed here before and truly love the hotel overall.  The only issue that I had was the price gouging tactic that was pulled on me when I mentioned that I would have a guest for a day.  The booking.com difference was $5 for 2 people.  The hotel charged me $24 for a guest and would not adjust their rate.  I know that if I stay here again, I will just book for 2 people and avoid this issue.
